New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player ever to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in the same season.
Shohei Ohtani set a Dodgers record with 10 RBIs in a game.
Shohei Ohtani hit his 50th home run, tying Shawn Green's franchise record set in 2001.
Shohei Ohtani hit his 51st home run, an upper-deck shot.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a six-for-six, three-homer, two-steal, 10-RBI tour de force.
Shohei Ohtani hit a three-homer game, giving him a career-high six hits.
The Marlins had rookie Connor Norby at third base, who stretched for the tag but Ohtani slid under it.
Shohei Ohtani laid off a two-strike curveball and hit a hanging meatball for his 50th home run.
Pre-Game Insights: Clayton McCullough predicted that Shohei Ohtani would get to 50-50 in the same game.
Manager Dave Roberts said that Ohtani's ability to come through in clutch situations was 'uncanny'.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani was received by hugs from teammates and a raucous roar from the crowd after hitting his 50th home run.
Manager Skip Schumaker praised the Dodgers for their performance and called it a 'good day for baseball' but a 'bad day for the Marlins'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a small crowd on a late afternoon.
The Dodgers clinched their 12th straight playoff berth and first for Shohei Ohtani.
The team's plane back to Los Angeles was packed and shuttled luggage as players talked with reporters and amongst themselves about the feats they'd just witnessed.
Others: Shohei Ohtani underwent Tommy John surgery to repair a tendon in his elbow on Sept. 19 of last year and made a remarkable recovery to achieve 50-50.
The team's clubhouse was filled with commemorative '50/50' T-shirts and champagne to celebrate the Dodgers' playoff berth.
